level.heading: REQUIRED NOTICE TO EMPLOYEES (§ 7-3206) An employee shall provide at least ten (10) days prior written notice to his orer employer of the employee’s planned use of paid leave, if the employee isware of the need to use such paid leave at least ten (10) days before the daten which the paid leave is to be used. If an employee becomes aware of the need to use paid leave less than ten (10)ays before the date on which the paid leave is to be used, the employee shallrovide written notice to the employer of the need to use the paid leave on theay that the employee becomes aware of the need to use the paid leave or,therwise as early as possible. If that day is not a business day for themployer, notice shall be given on the next business day. If the need to use paid leave is not foreseeable, the employee shall make anral request for paid leave prior to the start of the work shift for which theaid leave is requested. If an emergency prevents the employee from making prior notification to themployer of the need to use paid leave, the employer shall be notified prior tohe start of the next work shift or within 24 hour of the onset of themergency, whichever occurs sooner. An employee shall make a reasonable effort to schedule paid leave in a mannerhat does not unduly disrupt the operations of the employer. If paid leave isequested in a non-emergency situation, the employee shall consult with themployer regarding the date and time of the paid leave to be taken.
